resources.string: Walchand College of Engineering is situated midway between Sangli and Miraj cities at Vishrambag, Sangli. The WCE campus is located on about 90 acres of land on southern side of Sangli – Miraj road.

In 1947, the college made a modest beginning as New Engineering College, with a single program leading to B.E. (Civil) degree. In the year 1955, the College was renamed as Walchand College of Engineering as part of the new arrangements and pursuant to the Rehabilitation and Development Program mainly funded by Seth Walchand Hirachand Memorial Trust and the Government. The Government appointed an Ad Hoc Committee for conducting the college from May 1955, later replaced by the Administrative Council in 1956. The Ad Hoc Committee added two more degree programs in B.E. (Mechanical) and B.E. (Electrical) in 1955 with the intake of 20 each. Three Diploma programs also started in 1955 – Civil (40 intake), Mechanical (20) and Electrical (20).

Post Graduate programs in Civil, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering and Diploma program in Industrial Electronics were introduced in 1971. In 1986 the UG and PG programs in Electronics Engineering and UG program in Computer Science and Engineering were introduced.

PG program in CSE was introduced in 1997. In 2001, added B.E. program in Information Technology with an intake of 60 students. An additional intake of 30 students was also sanctioned for Computer Science and Engineering program, resulting in total intake of 390 students for all branches at UG level and 106 at PG level. As part of strategic planning, PG section is being strengthened and PG intake has now steadily risen to 240 across 10 programs. The College has a QIP scheme for full-time doctoral programs and also offers Ph. D. programs of Shivaji University in various branches of engineering.

The department of Civil Engineering is the oldest department of the college way back in 1947. Prof V.D.Salkar is HOD of Civil Engineering department. The department has been engaged in various activities involving industry-institute interaction, research and development, updating curriculum, improving teaching/learning process, development of students and service to society etc. Also every year departmental club CESA ( Civil Engineering Students Association ) organizes a national level technical fest named AAKAR.

The department of Mechanical was established in 1995.Dr. B. S. Gavali is HOD of the department. Prof Dr. U. A. Dabade and Mr. M. M. Khot received Young Scientist Award under SERC Fast Track from DST, India.

Various labs and equipments:
1. Advanced Manufacturing Laboratory
2. Refrigeration And Air Condition Lab
3. Heat Transfer Laboratory
4. IC Engine Laboratory

CSE Department of WCE,Sangli was established in 1986.Dr.B.F.Momin is Head of Department.Association of Computer Science and Engineering (ACSES) is departmental club . 

Various labs in the departments and major equipments :
1)Advanced Software Engineering Laboratory
2)Database Engineering Laboratory
3)Research Laboratory

Information Technology Department was established in year 2001. Dr.Mrs.S.P.Sonawane is HOD . Department has highly Equipped Labs and other facilities. Namely It has High Performance Lab,Microprocessor Lab, Programming Lab etc.. Only students of IT department are allowed to access any of the facilities of the department. Programming Lab can be accessed 24*7. Department focuses on Industry sponsored projects.

The Department of Electronics Engineering started way back in 1986. The department is headed by prominent personalities like Prof.V.B.Dharmadhikari(HOD),Prof.Dr.Mrs.S.S.Deshpande,Mr.S.N.Kore(Dean Academics). Department has well qualified faculty and support staff.Departmental club ELESA work towards improving skills of students through activities like Electrovert. It is a State Level event.

It is one of the largest libraries in the state. It houses an enormous array of reference books, international and national journals, research papers, textbooks and novels. It also contains a digital library consisting of thousands of renowned eBooks and journals, which are available for the students round the clock.
It comprises of two sections - one for boys and girls each. It provides a quaint environment for the students to aid studies.

It is a computer lab which consists of the latest computers and software. It is available for the students of all departments. This is the Place where your problems related Wi-Fi connection will be entertained.
The hostels for boys and girls are in separate areas. They are quite spacious and has every necessary facility. Separate Wi-Fi connections are available. Hostel life is the best part of college life

It houses of various equipment to help the students in fitness. We can access it in the early Morning hours and same is in the evening hours. Vartak hall has Badminton courts and huge playground is available for various sports.
It is a multipurpose hall .All the occasions are celebrated in Tilak hall. Several other things such as seminars and workshops are arranged here.
It is a holy place at WCE located near study room. Every day starts with Ganpati blessings which prospers and freshens the environment
These places provides you healthy and nutritious food in a clean and tidy environment

Q.2) Can one change the branch?\nAns: Yes one can change the branch after completion of First Year of Degree Course. All the students are notified to apply. Score of First Year is considered for this. Seats are allotted on Merit Basis.
Q.3) When will one get ID card?\nAns: It is the responsibility of every student to get the college card from stores and signed it by respective authorities as soon as the college starts.
Q.4) How to get Wi-Fi Id and password?\nAns: Students need to fill the form available in the college Xerox center and submit it to the control room and thus obtain the password.
Q.5) What is the policy of Book Bank?\nAns: Books will be provided to specific students on Merit basis. Merit Score of DTE is considered for this. Detailed Information will be displayed by concern.

Q.6) What are the timings to access study room?\nAns: College study room is well furnished and is strictly divided into two sections differently for boys and girls. Boys have the permission for 24 hours of the day while Girls are allowed till 10.00 pm.

Q.8) Does attendance matter for examination?\nAns: Yes. 75% attendance is compulsory for every student in individual subject else He/She is claimed as defaulter in particular subject. Several other rules regarding this are notified time to time by Examination Department.
